ARABIC: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَصَابَهُمُ ٱلْبَغْىُ هُمْ يَنتَصِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: those who, when they are wronged, defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And those who defend themselves when they are wronged.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: who, when a wrong is done to them, seek its redress.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and those who, when suffering a great injustice, seek to defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And those who take revenge when rebellion harms them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And those who, when an oppressive wrong is done to them, take revenge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And those who, when great wrong afflicts them, defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and who, when insolence visits them, do help themselves --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And those who, when great wrong is done to them, defend themselves,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: who, when they are attacked, defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And those who, when they are oppressed vindicate themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: those who, when afflicted by oppression, defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And those who, when an oppressive wrong is inflicted on them, (are not cowed but) help and defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And those who, when an oppressive wrong is done to them, they take revenge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and when harmed they become victorious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And those who, when wronged, defend themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [42:39] and those who, when they suffer aggression, injustice, defend themselves — these are another category — that is to say, they retaliate against those who wrong them in the same manner in which the latter wronged them, as God, exalted be He, says:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And those who, when great wrong) iniquity (is done to them, defend themselves) through the law of retaliation, not by means of presumptuousness,
